variant.question: In the attached image, which image represents COMPRESSION?
In the attached image, which image represents SHEAR FORCE?
Torsion in a wing can be caused by:

options.text: positive sweep.
propwash.
dihedral.
wing tip vortex.

variant.question: How can upwards wing flex be avoided?

options.text: Keep fuel in the wing tanks as long as possible.
Move C of G forwards.
Increase take off weight.
Place the engines closer to the fuselage.

variant.question: What is the purpose of the oil and the nitrogen in an oleo-pneumatic strut?

options.text: The oil supplies the damping function and the nitrogen supplies the spring function.
The oil supplies the spring function and the nitrogen has no effect
The oil supplies the spring function and the nitrogen supplies the damping function.
The oil supplies the damping and lubrication function, and the nitrogen supplies the heat-dissipation function.

variant.question: What is the purpose of the oil and the nitrogen in an oleo-pneumatic strut?

options.text: The oil supplies the damping function and the nitrogen supplies the spring function.
The oil supplies the spring function and the nitrogen supplies the heat dissipation function.
The oil supplies the spring function and the nitrogen supplies the damping function.
The oil supplies the damping and lubrication function, and the nitrogen supplies the heat dissipation function.

variant.question: A turbo compressor air conditioning system (bootstrap system) will

options.text: cause a pressure drop as well as an associated temperature drop in the charge air.
decrease charge air pressure whilst causing the temperature to rise in the heat exchanger.
not affect the charge air pressure.
increase charge air pressure whilst causing the temperature to drop in the heat exchanger.

variant.question: The main purpose of a Constant Speed Drive unit is to..

options.text: maintain a constant frequency.
achieve reactive load sharing.
provide voltage regulation.
mechanically protect the alternator drive shaft during coupling.

variant.question: A propeller blade is twisted in order to

options.text: maintain a constant angle of attack along the blade.
allow an increased mechanical load.
avoid the appearance of sonic phenomena.
reduce the blade tangential velocity from root to tip.

variant.question: The function of a diffuser (compensation jet) is to:

options.text: maintain a constant mixture in a piston engine at low and high power settings.
enable proper functioning of a piston engine during throttle advance.
enable engine idling.
enable engine starting.

variant.question: The air in a piston engine turbocharger enters the centrifugal compressor at:

options.text: the eye of the impeller and leaves it almost at a tangent to the periphery.
the diffuser and is fed to the impeller at the optimum angle of attack.
a tangent to the rotor and leaves via the stator.
the periphery and leaves via the eye of the impeller.

variant.question: A condenser in parallel with breaker points will:

options.text: intensify current in secondary winding.
assist in collapse of secondary winding.
assist in negative feedback to secondary coil.
permit arcing across points.

variant.question: The kind of compressor normally used as a supercharger is:

options.text: a radial compressor.
a piston compressor.
an axial compressor.
a hybrid compressor.

variant.question: The purpose of variable by-pass valves in a high bypass turbofan engine between the LP compressor and the HP compressor (HPC) is to:

options.text: prevent fan stall and LP compressor stall during engine start and low rotor speeds.
prevent HPC stall during engine start.
provide sufficient air to the HPC during engine start.
prevent fan surge at high rotor speeds -high rpm-.

variant.question:
Which of these statements about compressor stall in a gas turbine engine are correct or incorrect?
1 A compressor stall is most likely to occur in a compressor designed for a high pressure ratio operating at high RPM
2 A compressor stall is most likely to occur when the air flow stagnates in the rear stages of the compressor.

options.text: 1 is incorrect, 2 is correct.
I is correct, II is correct.
1 is incorrect, 2 is incorrect.
1 is correct, 2  is incorrect.

variant.question: The purpose of a compressor bleed valve is to prevent surging:

options.text: at low compressor RPM.
with altitude.
generated by foreign object ingestion.
of the first compressor stages.

variant.question: Which statement regarding the compressor stage of a gas turbine engine is correct?

options.text: The rotor increases the pressure and the speed of the airflow, the stator increases only the pressure.
The rotor increases only the pressure of the airflow, the stator increases the pressure and the speed of the airflow.
Both the rotor and the stator increase only the speed of the airflow.
Both the rotor and the stator increase only the pressure of the airflow.

variant.question: In a compressor stage, if the axial air velocity increases more than the rotor blade velocity the:

options.text: stall margin increases.
stall margin decreases.
relative air velocity becomes supersonic.
pressure ratio will be too high.

variant.question: The blades in an axial flow compressor decrease in size from the

options.text: low pressure to the high pressure stages in an attempt to sustain axial velocity.
high pressure to the low pressure stages in order to allow for expansion at increased velocity.
root to the tip in order to maintain a constant angle of attack.
root to the tip in order to increase tip clearance.

variant.question: For this question refer to the annex  In the annex, an axial compressor stage is represented by:

options.text: figure 1.
figure 2.
figure 4.
figure 3.

variant.question: The purpose of a variable bypass valve, fitted between the LP and HP compressor of an axial flow compressor, is to..

options.text: prevent stall in the LP compressor.
control the acceleration of the engine.
prevent the engine from an overspeed.
enable the engine to start with an external air supply.

variant.question: A stage in an axial compressor:

options.text: is made of a rotor disc followed by a ring of stator blades.
has a compression ratio in the order of 0.8.
is made of ring of stator blades followed by a rotor disc.
has a compression ratio in the order of 2.1.

variant.question: The purpose of a compressor bleed valve in a gas turbine engine is to..

options.text: prevent surging at low compressor rpm.
prevent surging generated by foreign object ingestion.
improve engine performance at high altitude.
prevent surging of the intermediate compressor only.

variant.question: By comparison with an axial flow compressor, a centrifugal compressor is

options.text: more robust and technologically less complicated.
lighter and has a high power to weight ratio.
more efficient and with a higher compression ratio.
fuel efficient and has higher thermal efficiencies.

variant.question:
Which of these statements about compressor stall are correct or incorrect?
 
1) A compressor stall is most likely to occur in a compressor designed for a high pressure ratio operating at low RPM.
 
2) A compressor stall is most likely to occur when the air flow stagnates in the front stages of the compressor.

options.text: 1) is correct, 2) is incorrect.
1) is correct, 2) is correct.
1) is incorrect, 2) is incorrect.
1) is incorrect, 2) is correct.

variant.question: In a gas turbine engine, compressor blades, which are not rigidly fixed in position when the engine is stationary, take up a rigid position when the engine is running due to

options.text: the resultant of aerodynamic and centrifugal forces.
oil pressure.
blade creep.
thermal expansion.

variant.question: The disadvantages of axial flow compressors compared to centrifugal flow compressors are that they..

options.text: are more expensive to manufacture and have greater vulnerability to foreign object damage.
have lower airflow and lower pressure ratio.
are more expensive to manufacture and have lower airflow.
have lower airflow and greater vulnerability to foreign object damage.

variant.question: In a single stage of a gas turbine axial compressor the sequence of blades is..

options.text: rotor – stator.
rotor – rotor – stator.
stator – rotor.
stator – stator – rotor.

variant.question: The compressor blades in a rotating gas turbine engine are held in position by...

options.text: the mountings, the aerodynamic force, and centrifugal force.
the mountings and thermal expansion only.
abradable seals and aerodynamic forces.
a centrifugal latch.

variant.question: The average stage compression ratio of a centrifugal compressor is approximately;
The compressor pressure ratio of an axial flow compressor of a gas turbine engine is primarily determined by the:

options.text: number of stages.
compressor inlet pressure design value.
compressor inlet temperature design value.
rotor diameter.

variant.question: Severe compressor stall can be indicated amongst others by:

options.text: a rise in turbine gas temperature (TGT) and a change in vibration level.
an increase in engine pressure ratio (EPR) and a decrease in TGT and fuel flow.
a rise in TGT and an increase in fuel flow.
a decrease in TGT and a change in vibration level.

variant.question: What is the purpose of the inlet guide vanes (IGV)?

options.text: Optimize the angle of the air flow across the first stage of the compressor.
Increase the velocity across the first stage of the turbine.
Optimize the angle of the air flow for the diffusor.
Reduce the velocity in the combustion chamber.

variant.question: In a centrifugal compressor:

options.text: the air enters the impeller axially at the eye and leaves at the periphery tangentially.
the air enters the eye radially and leaves the tip tangentially.
the air enters the eye tangentially and leaves the periphery axially.
the air enters the periphery axially and leaves the eye tangentially.

variant.question: In an axial compressor with 20 stages, the pressure rise is equal to 20% across every single stage. What is the overall compression ratio of such engine?
The station numbers before and after the HP compressor are

options.text: 3 and 4.
5 and 6.

variant.question: The station numbers before and after the HP compressor are

options.text: 3 and 4.
5 and 6.
2 and 3.
6 and 7.

variant.question: Which of the following statements regarding variable inlet guide vanes (VIGVs) and variable stator vanes (VSVs) on a high-bypass turbine engine is correct?

options.text: VIGVs are located at the front of the HP compressor and, together with the VSVs, control compressor airflow.
VIGVs prevent LP compressor stall and VSVs prevent HP compressor stall.
If VIGVs move towards the open position, VSVs move towards the closed position.
VIGVs are located in the front of the fan and control both fan and compressor air flow. VSVs are used in the compressor only and are used to increase pressure ratio.

variant.question: How do the gas parameters change within the stator of a compressor stage? - The temperature increases, the:

options.text: Pressure increases and the speed decreases.
Pressure decreases and the speed decreases.
Pressure increases and the speed increases.
Pressure decreases and the speed increases.

variant.question: About a twin spool compressor:

options.text: The low pressure spool runs at a lower RPM than the high pressure spool.
When operating at very high RPMs, the later stages within the high pressure spool will have a large negative angle of attack.
The low pressure spool runs at a very high RPM, thus preventing the onset of compressor stall.
Both spools run at the same RPM.

variant.question: One function of the diffuser, located between the compressor and the combustion chamber, of a gas turbine engine is to:

options.text: decrease the flow velocity.
increase total pressure.
increase the flow velocity of the compressed air.
convert kinetic energy into mechanical energy.

variant.question: An axial compressor, compared to a centrifugal compressor:

options.text: has a higher pressure ratio and the ability to compress a high mass of air.
has a higher pressure ratio and an inability to compress a high mass of air.
has a lower pressure ratio and the ability to compress a high mass of air.
has a lower pressure ratio and an inability to compress a high mass of air.

variant.question: The main purpose of a diffuser is...

options.text: to reduce velocity of gas into the combustion chamber.
to reduce the temperature of gases in the combustion chamber.
to increase total pressure in the combustion chamber.
to decrease static pressure in the combustion chamber.

variant.question: In a gas turbine engine, the Inlet Guide Vanes (IGV)

options.text: direct the airflow at the optimal angle to the compressor`s first stage.
direct the airflow at the optimal angle into the diffuser.
increase the velocity of the air entering the compressor.
reduce the velocity of the air entering the combustion section.

variant.question: Compressor stall in a gas turbine engine is due to:

options.text: an excessively high angle of attack of the rotor blades.
an excessively low angle of attack of the rotor blades.
an inadequate fuel flow.
an excessively high axial velocity.

variant.question: In a centrifugal compressor, air enters via the

options.text: eye of the impeller.
combustion chamber.
variable IGV.
diffuser.

variant.question:
The disadvantages of axial flow compressors compared to centrifugal flow compressors are:
1) more expensive to manufacture.
2) lower airflow.
3) greater vulnerability to foreign object damage.
4) lower pressure ratio.
The combination that regroups all of the correct statements is:
Compressor surge may be controlled by means of:

options.text: anti-ice bleed valves.
a variable metering orifice.
a pressure drop control orifice.
fixed inlet guide vanes.

variant.question: One reason to fit a tip shroud to a turbine blade is to:

options.text: increase turbine efficiency.
provide a seal for the cooling airflow.
prevent blade creep.
reduce turbine temperatures.

variant.question: On a triple spool engine what speed does the low pressure compressor run at?

options.text: Different speeds to the HP compressor, IP turbine
the same speed as the HP turbine
different speed to the LP turbine
the same speed as the HP compressor

variant.question: A diffuser reduces the velocity of gas entering the combustion chamber. The purpose of this is to...

options.text: increase the gas pressure, to ensure that the combustion does not stop.
reduce gas pressure, to ensure that the combustion does not stop.
reduce gas temperatures and decreasing the risk of overheating the combustion chamber.
increase the gas velocity through the combustion chamber.

variant.question: One stage of an axial compressor in a gas turbine engine comprises:

options.text: a row of rotor blades followed by a row of stator vanes.
a row of rotor blades followed by a row of inlet guide vanes.
a row of inlet guide vanes followed by a row of rotor blades.
inlet guide vanes followed by a row of rotor blades and a row of stator vanes.

variant.question: Compressor stall is due to:

options.text:
An excessively high angle of attack of the rotor
blades.
An excessively high axial velocity.

An excessively low angle of attack of the rotor
blades.
An inadequate fuel flow.

variant.question:
The characteristics of an axial compressor are:
1) a low pressure ratio by stage.
2) a high pressure ratio by stage.
3) the possibility of compressing a large mass airflow.
4) the inability of compressing a large mass airflow.
The combination that regroups all of the correct statements is:
